<a id="InputEventMouseButton"></a>

# InputEventMouseButton

**Inherits:** [InputEventMouse](InputEventMouse.md) **\<** [InputEventWithModifiers](InputEventWithModifiers.md) **\<** [InputEventFromWindow](InputEventFromWindow.md) **\<** [InputEvent](InputEvent.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Represents a mouse button being pressed or released.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Stores information about mouse click events. See [Node._input()](Node.md#Node_private_method__input).

\ **Note:** On Wear OS devices, rotary input is mapped to [@GlobalScope.MOUSE_BUTTON_WHEEL_UP](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_constant_MOUSE_BUTTON_WHEEL_UP) and [@GlobalScope.MOUSE_BUTTON_WHEEL_DOWN](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_constant_MOUSE_BUTTON_WHEEL_DOWN). This can be changed to [@GlobalScope.MOUSE_BUTTON_WHEEL_LEFT](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_constant_MOUSE_BUTTON_WHEEL_LEFT) and [@GlobalScope.MOUSE_BUTTON_WHEEL_RIGHT](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_constant_MOUSE_BUTTON_WHEEL_RIGHT) with the [ProjectSettings.input_devices/pointing/android/rotary_input_scroll_axis](ProjectSettings.md#ProjectSettings_property_input_devices/pointing/android/rotary_input_scroll_axis) setting.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Using InputEvent](../tutorials/inputs/inputevent.md)

- [Mouse and input coordinates](../tutorials/inputs/mouse_and_input_coordinates.md)

## Property Descriptions

<a id="InputEventMouseButton_property_button_index"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[MouseButton](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_MouseButton) **button_index** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#InputEventMouseButton_property_button_index)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_button_index**\ (\ value\: [MouseButton](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_MouseButton)\ )
- [MouseButton](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_MouseButton) **get_button_index**\ (\ )

The mouse button identifier, one of the [MouseButton](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_MouseButton) button or button wheel constants.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEventMouseButton_property_canceled"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **canceled** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#InputEventMouseButton_property_canceled)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_canceled**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_canceled**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the mouse button event has been canceled.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEventMouseButton_property_double_click"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **double_click** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#InputEventMouseButton_property_double_click)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_double_click**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_double_click**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the mouse button's state is a double-click.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEventMouseButton_property_factor"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **factor** = `1.0` [ðŸ”—](#InputEventMouseButton_property_factor)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_factor**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_factor**\ (\ )

The amount (or delta) of the event. When used for high-precision scroll events, this indicates the scroll amount (vertical or horizontal). This is only supported on some platforms; the reported sensitivity varies depending on the platform. May be ``0`` if not supported.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEventMouseButton_property_pressed"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **pressed** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#InputEventMouseButton_property_pressed)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_pressed**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_pressed**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the mouse button's state is pressed. If ``false``, the mouse button's state is released.
